intro: Cosmibuena paludicola, commonly known as the marsh beauty, is a rare flowering plant native to the wetlands of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its delicate, pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant thrives in moist, nutrient-poor soils and is often found in swampy or marshy habitats. Its leaves are elongated and slightly hairy, adapted to the humid environment. Cosmibuena paludicola plays an important role in maintaining the ecological balance of its wetland ecosystem.
